events.message: Customer reported a collision involving their car and a roadside barrier, requesting to file a claim for vehicle repair.
The submitted claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords related to vehicle collision found in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned promptly to handle the vehicle collision claim and reach out to the customer for next steps.
The insurance company officially acknowledged receipt of the auto accident claim and assured the customer that the process had started.
Customer was asked to submit photos of the damaged vehicle, police report, and repair estimates to support processing the collision claim.
Customer provided all the requested documents including police report and detailed images of the car damage for the insurance investigation.
The investigation team began assessing the evidence and documentation to validate the details of the auto accident claim.
Investigation concluded that the vehicle collision was accidental and covered by the policy, with all documents verified as authentic.
Insurance company proposed a settlement covering the cost of repairs based on the assessment and repair estimates submitted by the customer.
Customer expressed satisfaction with the quick claim processing and approval of the settlement offer for the auto accident repairs.
The insurance claim for the vehicle collision was approved following customer agreement on the proposed settlement terms.
Payment for the approved claim was successfully issued to the customerâ€™s designated bank account to cover vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim has been officially closed after confirmation that the customer received payment and repairs were completed.
All records related to this auto accident claim have been archived securely for future reference and compliance purposes.
